collectors.title: Database
collectors.titleDetails: (28 total Queries, 28 of them unique across 1 Connection)

queries.sql: SELECT * FROM `tbl_position` WHERE `posID` = '1'

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Obtain a schedule that shows the following:</p><ul><li>Amounts recoverable on contracts</li> <li>Provisions for onerous contracts</li> <li>Payments on account</li> <li>Cost of material purchases for use in a later stage of the contract</li> <li>Cost of material purchases for use in a later stage of the contract</li> <li>Rectification provisions</li> <li>Retentions (with details of expected dates of release).</li> </ul><p>Agree these items to the trial balance. <b>(P)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Contracts Recognised on the Percentage Completion Method</b></p> <p>Document which method the client uses to estimate the stage of completion of the contract. The most common ways are:</p> <ul> <li>Total costs incurred as a percentage of anticipated total costs;</li> <li>Surveys undertaken by the client, the counterparty or an independent surveyor;</li> <li>Completion of a physical proportion of the contract work or the completion of a proportion of the service contact. <b>(V)</b></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Where revenue is recognised using the total cost to complete method, undertake a retrospective review of previous contracts to determine how accurate the entity\\’s budgetary function has historically been. Review whether costs have accrued in line with expectations after the end of the reporting period.<b>(V)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Where revenue recognition is based on surveys consider the reliability of surveys undertaken. If the surveyor is independent complete the tests on N2. </p> <p>Where the surveyor is internal or a counterparty consider how reliable they are including:</p> <ul> <li>Whether both the client and the counter party have conducted surveys which are independent of each other</li> <li>The qualifications of the surveyor</li> <li>Site visits by the audit team or an expert employed by the auditor</li> <li>Whether subsequent valuations bring into question the validity of historic valuations</li> <li>Whether customers question or challenge interim valuations, or whether they only ever challenge the final valuation</li> <li>Correspondence / complaints from customers</li> <li>Invoices not raised promptly after a valuation has been undertaken, or delays in settlement of those invoices. <b>(V)</b></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Where revenue recognition is based on the physical completion of a specific number of bespoke units ensure these items are either physically inspected at the stock-take or are agreed to dispatch notes close to the period end. <b>(V)</b></p>\r\n<i>As these items are made to order, physical delivery at the reporting date is not necessary to trigger revenue recognition. Unless installation is a significant part of the contact the key issue is whether production has been completed by that date.</i>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Where income recognition is based on the completion of a proportion of a service contract confirm the validity of the state of completion by:</p> <ul> <li>Physical inspection (where possible);</li> <li>Internal progress reports or progress reports sent to the client</li> <li>Timesheets to determine whether the cost incurred to date are reasonable based on the level of service that has allegedly been provided and any budgets that exist</li> <li>Where necessary, consider the need for and expert to be involved. <b>(V)</b></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Cost Allocated to Contracts</b></p>\r\n<i>The key consideration is whether costs are completely and accurately allocated to contracts, or whether there is a risk that onerous contracts will not be identified due to them being \\‘disguised\\’.</i>\r\n<p>The tests here are in addition to the standard testing on cost of stock on E2.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Note any commission payments and consider whether they could represent a potential bribe. <b>(V)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Confirm validity of transfers between contracts. <b>(V)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Discuss with the client problematic contracts including, those that\:</p> <ul> <li>have been subject to frequent variations1</li> <li>are behind schedule</li> <li>have been subject to complaints</li> <li>are outside the normal scope of the services undertaken by the client. <b>(V)</b></li> </ul> <i>1 Consider whether variations should be accounted for as an alteration to the existing contract or whether the variation should be considered to be a separate \‘new\’ contract in its own right.</i>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Where not already undertaken, review internal reports where the client assesses whether actual costs are in line with budgeted costs and undertake a review of post period end costs to ensure they are in line with expectations. <b>(V)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>From the above contract review ensure that adequate provision is made for contracts where there are foreseeable losses including penalty provisions. <b>(V)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Enquire into any abandoned projects to ensure that a provision is made for all unavoidable future costs. <b>(V)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Undertake a retrospective review of onerous contract provisions to ensure that with the benefit of hindsight they proved to be reliable / reasonable. <b>(V)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Review files of signed contracts or accepted bespoke orders and ensure that these contracts have been correctly accounted for. <b>(C)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Review client team meeting minutes and workflow documents such as planning sheets to spot potentially unidentified contracts. <b>(C)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Ensure that where transactions tests have been undertaken on purchase orders or the allocation of wage records that any purchase order or element of wages that have not been allocated to a contract, represent valid administration expenditure. <b>(C)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Ensure that sales invoices have been raised in accordance with contractual terms. <b>(C)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Ensure retentions are accounted for as part of the total revenue receivable on the contract unless they are effectively a discount to the contract value as the client never actively pursues or recovers them. <b>(C)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Ensure that where revenue recognised is different to the total value of invoice raised that an appropriate balance as mounts recoverable on contracts is recognised. <b>(C)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Ensure that for completed contracts that consideration is given to the need to provide for a rectification provision. Assess the reasonableness of the rectification provision, and also undertake a retrospective review of previous provisions made. <b>(C)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Where debit and credit balances exist for the same contract consider whether these should be shown gross or net. <b>(C)</b></p>\r\n<i>FRS 102 gives little specific guidance on netting off balances on \\‘long-term contracts\\’. However, it would be inappropriate to show a stock balance where there is an onerous contract provision for the same contract. Conversely, due to their different legal natures it would appear inappropriate to net amounts recoverable on contracts against payments on account.</i>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Consider whether the time value of money is material enough to require retentions to be discounted. <b>(C)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Contracts where their outcome cannot be reliably assessed</b></p>\r\n<p>Where the outcome of a contract cannot be reliably assessed ensure that costs incurred are recognised in the period in which they are incurred and revenue is recognised to match costs (i.e. zero profit or loss is recognised on the contract).<b>(V)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Based on historic experience with the client and the client\\’s expertise at budgeting contracts, assess whether their assumption that the outcome of the contract cannot be reliably assessed is reasonable. <b>(V)</b></p>\r\n<i>The risk of aggressive earnings or tax management should be carefully considered</i>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Consider whether any such contracts may be become onerous. If so, establish whether an appropriate provision been made. <b>(V)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

timelineData.query: SELECT * FROM `tbl_position` WHERE `posID` = '1'

timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Where debit and credit balances exist for the same contract consider whether these should be shown gross or net. <b>(C)</b></p>\r\n<i>FRS 102 gives little specific guidance on netting off balances on \\‘long-term contracts\\’. However, it would be inappropriate to show a stock balance where there is an onerous contract provision for the same contract. Conversely, due to their different legal natures it would appear inappropriate to net amounts recoverable on contracts against payments on account.</i>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Consider whether the time value of money is material enough to require retentions to be discounted. <b>(C)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Contracts where their outcome cannot be reliably assessed</b></p>\r\n<p>Where the outcome of a contract cannot be reliably assessed ensure that costs incurred are recognised in the period in which they are incurred and revenue is recognised to match costs (i.e. zero profit or loss is recognised on the contract).<b>(V)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Based on historic experience with the client and the client\\’s expertise at budgeting contracts, assess whether their assumption that the outcome of the contract cannot be reliably assessed is reasonable. <b>(V)</b></p>\r\n<i>The risk of aggressive earnings or tax management should be carefully considered</i>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Consider whether any such contracts may be become onerous. If so, establish whether an appropriate provision been made. <b>(V)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.4.5 E2-4', '2.4.5 E2-4', '22', 'Active', '2024-04-10 12:14:16')

post.question:
Array
(
    [0] => <p>Obtain a schedule that shows the following:</p><ul><li>Amounts recoverable on contracts</li>
    <li>Provisions for onerous contracts</li>
    <li>Payments on account</li>
    <li>Cost of material purchases for use in a later stage of the contract</li>
    <li>Cost of material purchases for use in a later stage of the contract</li>
    <li>Rectification provisions</li>
    <li>Retentions (with details of expected dates of release).</li>
</ul><p>Agree these items to the trial balance. <b>(P)</b></p>
    [1] => <p><b>Contracts Recognised on the Percentage Completion Method</b></p>
<p>Document which method the client uses to estimate the stage of completion of the contract.  The most common ways are:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Total costs incurred as a percentage of anticipated total costs;</li>
    <li>Surveys undertaken by the client, the counterparty or an independent surveyor;</li>
    <li>Completion of a physical proportion of the contract work or the completion of a proportion of the service contact. <b>(V)</b></li>
</ul>
    [2] => <p>Where revenue is recognised using the total cost to complete method, undertake a retrospective review of previous contracts to determine how accurate the entity\’s budgetary function has historically been.  Review whether costs have accrued in line with expectations after the end of the reporting period.<b>(V)</b></p>
    [3] => <p>Where revenue recognition is based on surveys consider the reliability of surveys undertaken.  If the surveyor is independent complete the tests on N2. </p>
<p>Where the surveyor is internal or a counterparty consider how reliable they are including:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Whether both the client and the counter party have conducted surveys which are independent of each other</li>
    <li>The qualifications of the surveyor</li>
    <li>Site visits by the audit team or an expert employed by the auditor</li>
    <li>Whether subsequent valuations bring into question the validity of historic valuations</li>
    <li>Whether customers question or challenge interim valuations, or whether they only ever challenge the final valuation</li>
    <li>Correspondence / complaints from customers</li>
    <li>Invoices not raised promptly after a valuation has been undertaken, or delays in settlement of those invoices. <b>(V)</b></li>
</ul>
    [4] => <p>Where revenue recognition is based on the physical completion of a specific number of bespoke units ensure these items are either physically inspected at the stock-take or are agreed to dispatch notes close to the period end. <b>(V)</b></p>
<i>As these items are made to order, physical delivery at the reporting date is not necessary to trigger revenue recognition. Unless installation is a significant part of the contact the key issue is whether production has been completed by that date.</i>
    [5] => <p>Where income recognition is based on the completion of a proportion of a service contract confirm the validity of the state of completion by:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Physical inspection (where possible);</li>
    <li>Internal progress reports or progress reports sent to the client</li>
    <li>Timesheets to determine whether the cost incurred to date are reasonable based on the level of service that has allegedly been provided and any budgets that exist</li>
    <li>Where necessary, consider the need for and expert to be involved. <b>(V)</b></li>
</ul>
    [6] => <p><b>Cost Allocated to Contracts</b></p>
<i>The key consideration is whether costs are completely and accurately allocated to contracts, or whether there is a risk that onerous contracts will not be identified due to them being \‘disguised\’.</i>
<p>The tests here are in addition to the standard testing on cost of stock on E2.</p>
    [7] => <p>Note any commission payments and consider whether they could represent a potential bribe.  <b>(V)</b></p>
    [8] => <p>Confirm validity of transfers between contracts. <b>(V)</b></p>
    [9] => <p>Discuss with the client problematic contracts including, those that\:</p>
<ul>
    <li>have been subject to frequent variations1</li>
    <li>are behind schedule</li>
    <li>have been subject to complaints</li>
    <li>are outside the normal scope of the services undertaken by the client. <b>(V)</b></li>
</ul>
<i>1 Consider whether variations should be accounted for as an alteration to the existing contract or whether the variation should be considered to be a separate \‘new\’ contract in its own right.</i>
    [10] => <p>Where not already undertaken, review internal reports where the client assesses whether actual costs are in line with budgeted costs and undertake a review of post period end costs to ensure they are in line with expectations.   <b>(V)</b></p>
    [11] => <p>From the above contract review ensure that adequate provision is made for contracts where there are foreseeable losses including penalty provisions. <b>(V)</b></p>
    [12] => <p>Enquire into any abandoned projects to ensure that a provision is made for all unavoidable future costs.  <b>(V)</b></p>
    [13] => <p>Undertake a retrospective review of onerous contract provisions to ensure that with the benefit of hindsight they proved to be reliable / reasonable.  <b>(V)</b></p>
    [14] => <p>Review files of signed contracts or accepted bespoke orders and ensure that these contracts have been correctly accounted for. <b>(C)</b></p>
    [15] => <p>Review client team meeting minutes and workflow documents such as planning sheets to spot potentially unidentified contracts. <b>(C)</b></p>
    [16] => <p>Ensure that where transactions tests have been undertaken on purchase orders or the allocation of wage records that any purchase order or element of wages that have not been allocated to a contract, represent valid administration expenditure. <b>(C)</b></p>
    [17] => <p>Ensure that sales invoices have been raised in accordance with contractual terms.  <b>(C)</b></p>
    [18] => <p>Ensure retentions are accounted for as part of the total revenue receivable on the contract unless they are effectively a discount to the contract value as the client never actively pursues or recovers them. <b>(C)</b></p>
    [19] => <p>Ensure that where revenue recognised is different to the total value of invoice raised that an appropriate balance as mounts recoverable on contracts is recognised. <b>(C)</b></p>
    [20] => <p>Ensure that for completed contracts that consideration is given to the need to provide for a rectification provision.  Assess the reasonableness of the rectification provision, and also undertake a retrospective review of previous provisions made. <b>(C)</b></p>
    [21] => <p>Where debit and credit balances exist for the same contract consider whether these should be shown gross or net. <b>(C)</b></p>
<i>FRS 102 gives little specific guidance on netting off balances on \‘long-term contracts\’.  However, it would be inappropriate to show a stock balance where there is an onerous contract provision for the same contract.  Conversely, due to their different legal natures it would appear inappropriate to net amounts recoverable on contracts against payments on account.</i>
    [22] => <p>Consider whether the time value of money is material enough to require retentions to be discounted. <b>(C)</b></p>
    [23] => <p><b>Contracts where their outcome cannot be reliably assessed</b></p>
<p>Where the outcome of a contract cannot be reliably assessed ensure that costs incurred are recognised in the period in which they are incurred and revenue is recognised to match costs (i.e. zero profit or loss is recognised on the contract).<b>(V)</b></p>
    [24] => <p>Based on historic experience with the client and the client\’s expertise at budgeting contracts, assess whether their assumption that the outcome of the contract cannot be reliably assessed is reasonable.  <b>(V)</b></p>
<i>The risk of aggressive earnings or tax management should be carefully considered</i>
    [25] => <p>Consider whether any such contracts may be become onerous. If so, establish whether an appropriate provision been made. <b>(V)</b></p>
)
